TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CustomizableString extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a string-typed property with a default value that is used if a custom value has not been explicitly assigned.

remarks.para: It is common for a setting to have a default value that is calculated somehow—for example, it is inherited from the parent object. If a custom value is not specified, then the default value is used. Since the default value is calculated, it can cause the effective value to change. For example, if the default is inherited from a parent object, then the effective value may change because the parent was changed. By contrast, if a custom value has been assigned, then these external influences will not occur, even if the custom value happens to be the same string as the default value. The object manages three pieces of information: the current value, a read-only default value, and a Boolean state that indicates whether the default is being used.

For example, the property is represented as a CustomizableString object for which a default value is generated from the name of the underlying object is automatically reflected as changes to the generated URL segment. If a custom URL segment is not explicitly assigned, then changes to the name of the Term object will be reflected automatically as changes to the generated URL segment.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DefaultValue As String
public: property System::String ^ DefaultValue { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default value for the property.

remarks.para: The default value cannot be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). is determined by the containing class and cannot be assigned. To understand how it is calculated, see the property documentation for the containing class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Equals(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CustomizableString cstring) cil managed
Public Function Equals (cstring As CustomizableString) As Boolean

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current object.
Docs.summary: Supports the .NET infrastructure and normally is not used.

remarks.para: The return value is always false.
There is not a well-defined criterion for comparing two instances of the object The recommended alternative is to compare the property instead.

Comparisons with a a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) reference and unrelated types are supported, and always return false. Comparisons with a CustomizableString instance throw a NotSupportedException exception.

Docs.exception: The object was compared with another instance of a object, which is not supported.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UsesDefaultValue { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UsesDefaultValue : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the current value is the default value.
Docs.value: true if the current value is the default value; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: If the value returned for a property is true, then the property is updated automatically to reflect the property. Any changes to the DefaultValue property appear as changes to the Value property. If the value returned for a UsesDefaultValue property is false, then the Value property is customized, that is, it is no longer influenced by the DefaultValue property.
If the Value property and the DefaultValue property are equal, it does not necessarily indicate that the value for the UsesDefaultValue is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Value { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Value : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current value of this instance.
Docs.value: The current value of this CustomizableString instance.

remarks.para: The act of assigning any string to Value will cause it to become “customized”; that is, the property will no longer affect the Value property.

Docs.exception: The value to be assigned was null, which is not allowed.
